channel.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
channel.description:
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/2959161/hi__1_.png[/img] [COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Introduction[/SIZE][/color] Hello, my name's Matīss and I'm a WEB developer. I have seen a lot of RSPS sites use the same highscore system that is quite flawed - there are a lot of SQLi and XSS bugs. That's one of the reasons for creating this sys. Another one is that I started to learn coding about 4 years ago. This was the place where I started learning coding and I'm really grateful for that. I'm ready to give something back to the community.
[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Download[/SIZE][/color] [URL=http://www.mja.lv/hs/][IMG]http://www.inspiredisplays.com/Images/Blue_Software_Demo_Button.gif[/img][/URL] [URL=http://http://www.github.com/MatissJA/Highscores/archive/master.zip][img]http://www.opensure.net/files/2012/03/download2.png[/img][/URL] Github project (view the code): [URL=http://www.github.com/MatissJA/Highscores/]Click here[/URL]
[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Installation[/SIZE][/COLOR]
[ol][li] [COLOR=red]Install[/COLOR] XAMPP, WAMP or any other PHP+MySQL server[/li] [li] [COLOR=red]Download[/COLOR] the files Click on the image above[/li] [li] [COLOR=red]Drag and drop[/COLOR] the files to your public directory example: /htdocs/ if you're using XAMPP, /www/ for WAMP I believe[/li] [li] [COLOR=red]Open[/COLOR] up the install.php on your browser Example: [url=http://127.0.0.1/install.php]http://127.0.0.1/install.php[/url][/li] [li] [COLOR=red]Follow[/COLOR] the installation instructions there[/li][/ol]
Installations: [IMG]http://www.mja.lv/index.php/highscores/counter.png[/img]
[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Fin[/SIZE][/COLOR] I would be more than happy to post this in the RSPS section, but unfortunately I'm not really that much into Java. If anyone could create a tutorial on how to implement a SQL save in the server side - it would be just awesome! I will try to create a simple video instructional for absolute newbies as soon as I get over my cold. Currently the system has only 1 theme. Feel free to create yours and share them here. I would be more than happy to add your work to the codebase.

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @mjakal mjakal
item.description:
@mjakal wrote:

that's originally what i did, however i was hoping to extract the php code from a separate file if possible maybe a "include" or "require_once" would do the trick

Yes, you could load a separate class in the Controller. I’d suggest autoloading (http://php.net/manual/en/language.oop5.autoload.php) id you’re an advanced programmer

Thank you for the method. I reworked it quite a bit and added to the codebase (v1.3).

and i removed the author tag for SEO reasons, sorry about that, but it would make you as the author of my website, not just the highscores afaik
Google isn't indexing meta tags :)

Updated the system:

  • Pagination improvements
  • Go-to-page functionality added
  • Small bugfixes

Read full topic

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

that’s originally what i did, however i was hoping to extract the php code from a separate file if possible maybe a “include” or “require_once” would do the trick

here’s the gotopage function

public function gotopage() { $amount = urlencode($_POST['pagetogo']); if ($amount < 1) $amount = 1; if (is_numeric($amount) == false) $amount = 1; $page = (isset($_POST['pagetogo']) ? 'index/' . urlencode($_POST['pagetogo']) : ''); $page = preg_replace('/[^a-z_\-0-9\/\s+]/i', '', $page); header('Location: ' . base_url($page)); }

hopefully it’s done properly

the compare function that i currently have…

[code] public function compare()
{
$page = (isset($_POST[‘username’]) ? ‘compare/’ . urlencode($POST[‘username’]) : ‘’);
$page = preg_replace(’/[^a-z-0-9/\s+]/i’, ‘’, $page);
die('Location: ’ . base_url($page));

}[/code]

but i have to head to work now but ill look into the method you posted and work from that

and i removed the author tag for SEO reasons, sorry about that, but it would make you as the author of my website, not just the highscores afaik

Read full topic

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @mjakal mjakal
item.description:
@mjakal wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:14, topic:477590”]wow that’s weird i was searching for this through google and a update today

was going to look into contacting you about adding new pages to it, never worked with this kind of system
but since you’re still active maybe you’ll see this point

i’ve been messing with it for a while, added in image displaying system and modified the template in a few places, and really messed with the database to reduce a lot of unneeded calculations

here’s mine so far
http://sg-forum.com/hs2/0/
i’m trying to make the compare work, but the redirection is odd, could you perhaps explain how i would go about adding new features such as a new page with my own php[/quote]

Just create a new public method in the sys/controller.php file. For example:

pubic function compare() {
    $user1 = $_POST['user1'];
    $user2 = $_POST['user2'];

    $user1_data = $this->db->query('SELECT * FROM ... WHERE username= ... ', $this->model_name);
    $user2_data = $this->db->query('SELECT * FROM ... WHERE username= ... ', $this->model_name);
    
    $this->load('compare', array(
        'user1' => $user1_data,
        'user2' => $user2_data,
    ));
}

Ps. - mind sharing your upgrades (e.g. go to page) with the community? E-mail me or just create a new Pull Request @Github.
Pss. - removing my name from the Author tag was a douche move… =/

Read full topic

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @mjakal mjakal
item.description:
@mjakal wrote:

A few of you reported that it doesn’t work when in fact your server simply doesn’t have mod rewrite. I quickly updated the system so now you can choose - weather to use it or not (by default it’s turned off). Please download the latest files and re:install it (delete config.php and .htaccess and then launch install.php). I hope this will help some people.

Feel free to ask questions here or PM/email me.

Read full topic

item.description:

I like it, i love that its blank so that everybody can edit it their way, and nobody has the same highscores.

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @mjakal mjakal
item.description:
@mjakal wrote:

Server Sniffer:

Fix your demo link

Sorry, didn’t notice it was broken. Fixed.

runescape sucks:

This is a good idea for anyone who wants to make a custom highscores, but other than that, it’s just too blank for my eye.

Yes, currently there aren’t many themes. I do hope that the community will create some, but other than that - this system is much safer than a lot other open-sourced highscore systems. Most of them have SQLi or XSS related problems.

Read full topic

item.title: [WEB][v1.3] `scape Highscore system
item.dc:creator: @mjakal mjakal
item.description:
@mjakal wrote:


[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Introduction[/SIZE][/color]
Hello, my name’s Matīss and I’m a WEB developer. I have seen a lot of RSPS sites use the same highscore system that is quite flawed - there are a lot of SQLi and XSS bugs. That’s one of the reasons for creating this sys. Another one is that I started to learn coding about 4 years ago. This was the place where I started learning coding and I’m really grateful for that. I’m ready to give something back to the community.

[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Download[/SIZE][/color]


Github project (view the code): Click here

[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Installation[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[ol][li] [COLOR=red]Install[/COLOR] XAMPP, WAMP or any other PHP+MySQL server[/li]
[li] [COLOR=red]Download[/COLOR] the files
Click on the image above[/li]
[li] [COLOR=red]Drag and drop[/COLOR] the files to your public directory
example: /htdocs/ if you’re using XAMPP, /www/ for WAMP I believe[/li]
[li] [COLOR=red]Open[/COLOR] up the install.php on your browser
Example: http://127.0.0.1/install.php[/li]
[li] [COLOR=red]Follow[/COLOR] the installation instructions there[/li][/ol]

Installations:

[COLOR=#FF7400][SIZE=6]Fin[/SIZE][/COLOR]
I would be more than happy to post this in the RSPS section, but unfortunately I’m not really that much into Java. If anyone could create a tutorial on how to implement a SQL save in the server side - it would be just awesome!
I will try to create a simple video instructional for absolute newbies as soon as I get over my cold.
Currently the system has only 1 theme. Feel free to create yours and share them here. I would be more than happy to add your work to the codebase.

Read full topic
